oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Short interval from calving to milking is essential for high lgG content in colostrum
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lokke, M. M.
Engelbrecht, R.
Wiking, L.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: parturition
milking
colostrum
antibodies
dairy cattle
small farms
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The aim of this study was to investigate the effect of time passed from parturition to milking, and from these data propose a scheme that can be used at smaller farms to increase the likelihood of harvesting colostrum with a high content of antibodies.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2016; 185-186
